newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: High Swiss sight deposits shows SNB meeting demand.
newsitem.headline: High Swiss sight deposits shows SNB meeting demand.

text.p: The Swiss National Bank (SNB) said the high level of sight deposits in the middle of August illustrated the continued demand for liquidity in the Swiss money markets and the SNB's willingness to meet this demand.
"The level of sight deposits shows the continued high demand for liquidity in the money markets and the SNB's willingness to meet this demand," an SNB spokesman said in response to inquiries.
Swiss sight deposits, or accounts commercial banks are required to hold at the SNB, rose 96.3 million Swiss francs to 3.07 billion in the reporting period ended August 20.
The SNB has recently been adding liquidity to Swiss money markets in an effort to ease upward pressures, especially in the short end of the market.
